task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for Ali Khaledi Nasab's current employment and professional background in AI research
task_1.data:
As of 2024, Dr. Ali Khaledi Nasab is an AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products. He joined Amazon in October 2022 as a research scientist in the AWS Network Capacity Planning organization. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi Nasab earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University in 2019, where his research centered on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai)) Following his doctoral studies, he served as a postdoctoral researcher in the Department of Neurosurgery at Stanford University School of Medicine, developing stimulation methods for neurological disorders like Parkinson's disease. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai)) He then joined CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on treatments for epilepsy, before transitioning to Amazon.

In addition to his role at Amazon, Dr. Khaledi Nasab is an adjunct professor of Physics at Ohio University and has contributed as an editor to the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for significant contributions in Clinical Medicine. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_2.query_used: Search GitHub and GitLab repositories for code contributions by Ali Khaledi Nasab related to artificial intelligence projects
task_2.data:
I searched GitHub and GitLab repositories for code contributions by Ali Khaledi-Nasab related to artificial intelligence projects but did not find any publicly available repositories under his name. However, Ali Khaledi-Nasab has authored several research papers in the field of artificial intelligence and computational neuroscience.

One notable publication is titled "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," co-authored with Christopher Currin and Sebastian Vallejo Vera. This study explores how introducing random inputs into social networks can prevent the formation of echo chambers and promote neutral consensus. ([export.arxiv.org](https://export.arxiv.org/abs/2101.04079v2?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, his Google Scholar profile lists other works focusing on machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

While specific code repositories were not found, these publications indicate his active involvement in artificial intelligence research.

citations.title: [2101.04079v2] Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge

task_3.query_used: Search Google Scholar and academic databases for research papers authored by Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI and machine learning
task_3.data:
I conducted a search for research papers authored by Ali Khaledi Nasab in the fields of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning. However, I did not find any publications directly attributed to him in these areas. It's possible that his work is not widely available in public academic databases, or he may have contributed under a different name or in collaboration with other researchers.

If you have more specific information about his research focus, affiliations, or any particular publications, please provide those details, and I can assist you further in locating relevant materials.

task_4.query_used: Search ResearchGate and academia.edu profiles for Ali Khaledi Nasab's academic publications and citations
task_4.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a researcher with a focus on machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. According to his Google Scholar profile, he has authored 23 publications, which have collectively garnered 426 citations, resulting in an h-index of 10 and a g-index of 21. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

One of his notable works is the article titled "Standing up to fear," published on Academia.edu. In this piece, Khaledi-Nasab discusses the challenges faced by international students in the United States amid changing political climates and emphasizes the importance of institutional support for these students. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, his research includes studies on the synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles using green methods, as well as investigations into the optical properties of quantum dots. These contributions highlight his diverse expertise in both theoretical and applied aspects of physics and materials science. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

While specific citation counts for individual publications are not detailed in the available sources, the overall citation metrics indicate a significant impact in his fields of study.

citations.title: (PDF) Standing up to fear | Ali Khaledi Nasab - Academia.edu

task_5.data:
Based on the available information, there is no evidence indicating that Ali Khaledi Nasab holds positions or ownership in any companies. The search results primarily highlight his academic and professional background, including his role as a doctoral candidate in physics and astronomy at Ohio University ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai)), his authorship of articles on Medium ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/?utm_source=openai)), and his contributions to scientific research ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai)).

It's important to note that corporate registries and business databases may not always provide comprehensive information on all individuals, especially if they do not hold significant positions or ownership stakes in publicly listed companies. Therefore, the absence of information in these sources does not conclusively indicate that an individual has no business affiliations.

task_6.data: After searching patent databases, I did not find any AI-related patents filed by or mentioning Ali Khaledi Nasab. While he has an academic background in physics and has been involved in research at institutions such as Ohio University ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai)) and Amazon ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/publications?utm_source=openai)), there is no record of his involvement in AI-related patents.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_7.query_used: Search news articles and press releases mentioning Ali Khaledi Nasab in connection with AI research or technology companies
task_7.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a research scientist specializing in computational methods to understand complex systems, with a focus on AI and nonlinear dynamics. Since 2022, he has been employed at Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a research scientist in the Network Capacity Planning organization. In addition to his professional role, he pursues independent research projects in his free time, which he refers to as "night science." These projects explore problems at the intersection of nonlinear dynamics, computer science, and AI. One notable outcome from this work is his paper titled "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," published in *Scientific Reports* in 2022. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

Prior to joining AWS, Khaledi Nasab worked at Coda Biotherapeutics, Inc., focusing on designing chemogenetic approaches for treating neurological disorders such as epilepsy and pain. He also held a postdoctoral position at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, where he designed stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease. His research during this period led to several publications on coordinated reset stimulation and its effects on neural networks. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

Khaledi Nasab earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University, where he studied the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks under the guidance of Professor Alexander Neiman. His doctoral research focused on understanding the dynamical principles of sensory neurons with tree-like morphologies. During his graduate studies, he received an American Physical Society Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award to present his work at the APS meeting in Boston. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his research, Khaledi Nasab has shared his experiences and insights through various platforms. He has written about his favorite books and provided advice on successful job interviews on his Medium blog. ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/?utm_source=openai))

Overall, Ali Khaledi Nasab's career encompasses significant contributions to AI research and technology companies, with a strong foundation in physics and computational methods applied to complex systems.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_8.query_used: Search conference proceedings and speaker lists for AI conferences featuring Ali Khaledi Nasab as presenter or attendee
task_8.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab has actively participated in several conferences, presenting his research in physics and neuroscience. In March 2019, he attended the American Physical Society (APS) annual meeting in Boston, where he presented a paper titled "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons." His participation was supported by an APS Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Earlier, in October 2017, Khaledi Nasab delivered a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster's Department of Physics. His presentation, "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements," focused on the stochastic dynamics of tree networks in sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

While these engagements highlight his contributions to physics and neuroscience, there is no available information indicating his participation as a presenter or attendee in AI-focused conferences.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Khaledi Nasab Gives Colloquium Talk at College of Wooster - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_9.query_used: Search Twitter, Facebook, and other social media platforms for professional accounts of Ali Khaledi Nasab discussing AI research
task_9.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He maintains a personal website where he shares his professional journey, research interests, and updates. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

On his website, Ali discusses his background in physics and neuroscience, which has led him to become an AI scientist. He mentions his expertise in machine learning, deep learning, generative AI, nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. He also highlights his commitment to continuous learning, dedicating two hours daily to reading books and taking courses. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Ali's website also features a section called "Ali's Notes," where he shares his thoughts on various topics, including his favorite books and advice for future graduate students and postdocs. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/alis-notes?utm_source=openai))

While Ali's website provides comprehensive information about his professional activities and research, there is no indication of active professional accounts on Twitter, Facebook, or other social media platforms discussing his AI research. The search results did not reveal any such accounts.

citations.title: Ali Khaledi, Ph. D. - Ali's Notes

task_10.query_used: Search university faculty directories and staff pages for Ali Khaledi Nasab's academic affiliations
task_10.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab has an extensive academic background in physics and neuroscience. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics & Astronomy from Ohio University, where he focused on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons with myelinated dendrites. His doctoral research was supervised by Dr. Alexander Neiman. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

Following his Ph.D., Dr. Khaledi Nasab joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery as a postdoctoral researcher. At Stanford, he worked with Dr. Peter Tass on designing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease. His research aimed to improve the efficacy of coordinated reset stimulation by developing new stimulation techniques. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

In 2022, Dr. Khaledi Nasab transitioned to the private sector, joining Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a research scientist in the Network Capacity Planning organization. Concurrently, he initiated independent research projects, referred to as "night science," focusing on problems at the intersection of nonlinear dynamics, computer science, and artificial intelligence. One of his notable publications from this endeavor is "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," published in Scientific Reports in 2022. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/about?utm_source=openai))

Throughout his career, Dr. Khaledi Nasab has demonstrated a commitment to interdisciplinary research, leveraging computational methods to address complex problems in physics, neuroscience, and beyond.

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Ali Khaledi Nasab is an AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, specializing in generative AI products.  He has a background in physics and neuroscience, earning his Ph.D. from Ohio University in 2019. While his public-facing work displays an academic focus on complex systems and neuroscience, his current role indicates a shift towards applied AI.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**

* Currently employed as an AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products (since 2024).
* Joined Amazon in October 2022 as a research scientist in the AWS Network Capacity Planning organization.
* Postdoctoral experience after completing his Ph.D. (specific details unavailable).
* Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University in 2019. Research focused on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons.

**Business & Financial Activity**

* No evidence of company ownership or executive positions.

**Legal or Criminal Mentions**

* No mentions found.

**Academic / Public Recognition**

* Authored 23 publications with 426 citations, h-index of 10, and g-index of 21 according to Google Scholar.
* Publication titled "Standing up to fear" on Academia.edu.
* Publication: "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," co-authored with Christopher Currin and Sebastian Vallejo Vera.
* Presented at the American Physical Society (APS) annual meeting in Boston, March 2019, on "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons."
* Received the APS Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award.
* Gave a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster in October 2017 (topic unspecified).

**Online / Social Presence**

* Maintains a personal website (alikhaledi.com) with information about his background, research interests, and professional updates.
* Active on Medium (ali-khaledi1989.medium.com).
* No apparent presence on Twitter or Facebook related to AI research.
* Loop Frontiers profile showcasing publications.

**Other Notable Mentions**

* Refers to his independent research projects as "night science," exploring problems at the intersection of nonlinear dynamics, computer science, and AI.


### Risk Profile

Based on available information, Ali Khaledi Nasab presents a low reputational risk.  His background, publications, and current employment at Amazon suggest a strong academic and professional track record. No negative information was found regarding his legal, financial, or public standing.

flagged_issues: Contradictory information about postdoctoral experience - report states 'specific details unavailable' but retrieval evidence provides detailed information about postdoc at Stanford and work at CODA Biotherapeutics
Missing important career details from retrieval evidence including Stanford postdoc position and CODA Biotherapeutics role
Report doesn't mention his adjunct professor position at Ohio University or his editorial contribution to the Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health
Incomplete academic presentation information - retrieval evidence provides specific talk title at College of Wooster in 2017
Report states 'No apparent presence on Twitter or Facebook' but retrieval evidence only confirms no accounts were found discussing AI research specifically
judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 11, 2025

### Executive Summary

Ali Khaledi Nasab is an AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, specializing in generative AI products. He has a background in physics and neuroscience, earning his Ph.D. from Ohio University in 2019. His career trajectory shows a progression from academic research in complex systems and neuroscience through postdoctoral work at Stanford University and industry experience at CODA Biotherapeutics, before transitioning to applied AI at Amazon.

### Thematic Summary of Key Findings

**Professional / Career Background**

* Currently employed as an AI scientist at Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products (since 2024)¹
* Joined Amazon in October 2022 as a research scientist in the AWS Network Capacity Planning organization¹
* Postdoctoral researcher at Stanford University School of Medicine, Department of Neurosurgery, where he developed stimulation methods for neurological disorders including Parkinson's disease¹⁷
* Worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, Inc., a gene therapy startup, designing chemogenetic approaches for treating epilepsy and pain¹⁷
* Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University in 2019. Research focused on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons¹
* Currently serves as an adjunct professor of Physics at Ohio University¹

**Business & Financial Activity**

* No evidence of company ownership or executive positions⁵

**Legal or Criminal Mentions**

* No mentions found¹¹

**Academic / Public Recognition**

* Authored 23 publications with 426 citations, h-index of 10, and g-index of 21 according to Google Scholar⁴
* Publication titled "Standing up to fear" on Academia.edu, discussing challenges faced by international students⁴
* Publication: "Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge," co-authored with Christopher Currin and Sebastian Vallejo Vera, published in Scientific Reports (2022)²⁷
* Presented at the American Physical Society (APS) annual meeting in Boston, March 2019, on "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons"⁸
* Received the APS Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award⁸
* Gave a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster in October 2017 titled "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements"⁸
* Contributing editor to the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for significant contributions in Clinical Medicine¹

**Online / Social Presence**

* Maintains a personal website (alikhaledi.com) with information about his background, research interests, and professional updates⁹
* Active on Medium (ali-khaledi1989.medium.com)⁵
* Has a Loop Frontiers profile showcasing publications⁶
* No professional accounts found on Twitter or Facebook specifically discussing AI research⁹

**Other Notable Mentions**

* Refers to his independent research projects as "night science," exploring problems at the intersection of nonlinear dynamics, computer science, and AI⁷
* Expertise spans machine learning, deep learning, generative AI, nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences⁹
* Dedicates two hours daily to continuous learning through reading books and taking courses⁹

### Risk Profile

Based on available information, Ali Khaledi Nasab presents a low reputational risk. His background, publications, and current employment at Amazon suggest a strong academic and professional track record. No negative information was found regarding his legal, financial, or public standing.

---
**Citations:**
¹ Task 1: alikhaledi.com
² Task 2: export.arxiv.org
³ Task 3: No relevant results found
⁴ Task 4: scholar.google.com, academia.edu
⁵ Task 5: Various sources
⁶ Task 6: loop.frontiersin.org
⁷ Task 7: alikhaledi.com
⁸ Task 8: ohio-forum.com
⁹ Task 9: alikhaledi.com
¹⁰ Task 10: Not provided
¹¹ Task 11: No results found
¹² Task 12: No results found

([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his research, Khaledi Nasab has shared his experiences and insights through various platforms. He has written about his favorite books and provided advice on successful job interviews on his Medium blog. ([ali-khaledi1989.medium.com](https://ali-khaledi1989.medium.com/?utm_source=openai))

Overall, Ali Khaledi Nasab's career encompasses significant contributions to AI research and technology companies, with a strong foundation in physics and computational methods applied to complex systems.

task_8.query_used: Search conference proceedings and speaker lists for AI conferences featuring Ali Khaledi Nasab as presenter or attendee
task_8.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab has actively participated in several conferences, presenting his research in physics and neuroscience. In March 2019, he attended the American Physical Society (APS) annual meeting in Boston, where he presented a paper titled "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons." His participation was supported by an APS Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Earlier, in October 2017, Khaledi Nasab delivered a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster's Department of Physics. His presentation, "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements," focused on the stochastic dynamics of tree networks in sensory neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

While these engagements highlight his contributions to physics and neuroscience, there is no available information indicating his participation as a presenter or attendee in AI-focused conferences.

task_9.query_used: Search Twitter, Facebook, and other social media platforms for professional accounts of Ali Khaledi Nasab discussing AI research
task_9.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He maintains a personal website where he shares his professional journey, research interests, and updates. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

On his website, Ali discusses his background in physics and neuroscience, which has led him to become an AI scientist. He mentions his expertise in machine learning, deep learning, generative AI, nonlinear dynamics, stochastic processes, signal processing, statistics, biophysics, and network sciences. He also highlights his commitment to continuous learning, dedicating two hours daily to reading books and taking courses. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Ali's website also features a section called "Ali's Notes," where he shares his thoughts on various topics, including his favorite books and advice for future graduate students and postdocs. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/alis-notes?utm_source=openai))

While Ali's website provides comprehensive information about his professional activities and research, there is no indication of active professional accounts on Twitter, Facebook, or other social media platforms discussing his AI research. The search results did not reveal any such accounts.
